thread.title: Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G with 5-inch display, quad-core SoC and 8GB storage launched
thread.title_full: Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G with 5-inch display, quad-core SoC and 8GB storage launched

title: Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G with 5-inch display, quad-core SoC and 8GB storage launched
text:
Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G with 5-inch display, quad-core SoC and 8GB storage... Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G with 5-inch display, quad-core SoC and 8GB storage launched By March 9, 2017 “The Aura Sleek 4G is an entry-level offering with 4G and VoLTE support” 
Karbonn has added a new budget smartphone to its Android portfolio with the launch of the Aura Sleek 4G . This is an entry-level offering with 4G LTE connectivity and VoLTE (voice over LTE) support for high-definition calling. 
The Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G features a 5-inch display bearing a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels. The phone is powered by a 1.0GHz quad-core processor, mated to 1GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 8GB, further expandable up to 32GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The Aura Sleek 4G gets a 5-megapixel primary shooter with an LED flash and autofocus, and a 2-megapixel selfie snapper. Apart from 4G and VoLTE, the other connectivity features include dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth. A 2,000mAh battery keeps the handset alive. 
The Karbonn Aura Sleek 4G has been listed on the company’s website, but there’s no word regarding its price and availability at the moment.
